page.title: 02INTRODUCTION TWO.
page.content: In 1921 the parishes of Fawley and Dibden together had a population of 4085,but the establishment of an oil refinery at Fawley in 1920 brought about an increase in house building which gained momentum after the refinery expansion in 1951. Inter-war housing development in Blackfield was linear and rather untidy,followed in the post-war era by in filling. In 1951 the New Forest Rural District Council built 201 houses near Blackfield. Improvements to the main drainage system in the 70's made further development possible but this was due to the proximity to Southampton rather than the refinery at Fawley. Future development now looks limited due to lack of suitable infilling sites,extraction of gravel, agricultural objections to the south and the nearness of the Nee Forest.
